title: 30 Healthy Snacks For On-the-go
summary: Greek yogurt with berries and granola is one of the healthiest and tastiest ways to start your day. Rice cakes with hummus paired with rice cakes are a fantastic alternative to crackers, chips, and other carb-heavy snacks. Whole grain crackers with cheese crackers are a great choice for when you have the time to sit down and eat. Japanese people are sometimes seen as having a healthy diet, but that's not the entire story. The Japanese diet has traditionally included a high consumption of fish and a wide range of vegetables.

The problem is that it\u2019s not always easy to find healthy snacks that are also fast and convenient. In our hectic, on-the-go world, most of us don\u2019t have time to sit down for a healthy meal three times a day. Instead, we\u2019re often forced to make snap decisions about what we can eat quickly and conveniently. Unfortunately, those decisions too often lead to less than healthy snack options like potato chips or sweets. However, there are plenty of great ways to get your recommended daily intake of fruits and veggies even when you\u2019re on the go. These 30 healthy snacks for on-the-go are perfect for keeping in your purse, desk drawer, locker, or anywhere else you might find yourself hungry and without access to a full meal."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

It\u2019s loaded with protein to keep you feeling full longer and it\u2019s packed with vitamins, minerals, and other nutrients. By buying the plain, non-fat Greek yogurt, you can save calories and fat compared with the flavored varieties. Plus, you can add fresh berries, granola for crunch, and a drizzle of honey for sweetness. The Greek yogurt will also help to keep the granola from getting soggy, as it doesn\u2019t require any milk or yogurt."),mdx("p",null,"This is also a good make-ahead option. Prepare the yogurt, granola, and berries in separate containers and then just combine them right before eating. You can even put everything into a plastic bag to make it easy to transport."),mdx("h2",null,"Rice cakes with hummus"),mdx("p",null,"Rice cakes are a fantastic alternative to crackers, chips, and other carb-heavy snacks. They\u2019re light and crispy and they taste great with any number of topping options. You can also find them in a number of different flavors and even in savory varieties, which are especially good with hummus. Hummus makes for a great healthy snack on its own, but it\u2019s even better paired with rice cakes."),mdx("p",null,"You can buy rice cakes in bulk and keep a supply on hand for whenever you\u2019re hungry. They\u2019re also a great option for kids\u2019 lunch boxes because they don\u2019t get soggy or crumbly like crackers do."),mdx("h2",null,"Veggie sticks and hummus"),mdx("p",null,"Hummus is a great choice for veggie sticks because it\u2019s rich in protein and other nutrients while being low in calories\u2014plus it tastes great on veggies. You can buy hummus in a variety of flavors, including garlic, roasted red pepper, and lemon. Use veggie sticks with the skin on to get more fiber and vitamins."),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re buying ready-made veggie sticks, make sure to read the label to make sure they\u2019re not heavily salted or otherwise processed. It\u2019s better to buy fresh vegetables and cut them up yourself. You can use a vegetable peeler to make the process quick and easy."),mdx("h2",null,"Fruit and yogurt parfait"),mdx("p",null,"A classic parfait made from yogurt, granola, and fresh fruit is a great way to start the day or to kill the afternoon hunger pangs. You can buy granola in bulk and make sure it has no added sugar or other unnecessary ingredients. You can also make your own granola at home."),mdx("p",null,"When buying yogurt, make sure to choose a brand that has no added sugar and uses whole milk, as opposed to low-fat or non-fat milk. You\u2019ll get more nutrients that way. Plus, yogurt is a great source of probiotics, which can help improve digestion."),mdx("h2",null,"Whole grain crackers with cheese"),mdx("p",null,"A healthy snack doesn\u2019t have to be all about quick and easy. Sometimes, you just have to take the time to sit down at a table to eat. Cheese crackers are a great choice for when you have the time to sit down and eat. These are light and easy to transport, so you can easily bring them to work, school, or anywhere else where you\u2019re in a snack-friendly environment."),mdx("p",null,"Try to find crackers that have low sodium, low fat, and no preservatives. You can also make your own cheese crackers at home by topping cracker squares with a mixture of cheese and spices. This is also a great way to use up extra cheese that\u2019s past its best-by date."),mdx("h2",null,"Kashi Golean"),mdx("p",null,"Golbal and regional diets are always being studied, questioned and adjusted and this is particularly true of the Japanese diet. In the West, Japanese people are sometimes seen as having a healthy diet, but that's not the entire story. In fact, the Japanese diet has traditionally included a high consumption of fish and a wide range of vegetables."),mdx("p",null,"A lesser known but fascinating aspect of the Japanese diet is that it often includes seaweed. While this might sound strange to many people outside Japan, seaweed is actually an important part of the traditional diet there. In fact, it accounts for around 20% of the calories in the diet."),mdx("h2",null,"Frozen fruit smoothie maker"),mdx("p",null,"Frozen fruit smoothies are a fantastic choice for when you need a quick snack. They\u2019re easy to make at home but they\u2019re also available to purchase premade in many stores. They\u2019re great because they\u2019re refreshing and they\u2019re also packed with vitamins, minerals, and other nutrients."),mdx("p",null,"These smoothies are usually made with yogurt as a base, so they\u2019re a good source of protein and calcium. They\u2019re also usually sweetened with either sugar or artificial sweeteners. If you want to make them healthier, try adding fresh or frozen fruit and water instead. You can also add protein powder if you want a more substantial snack."),mdx("h2",null,"Individual serving oatmeal packets"),mdx("p",null,"Oatmeal is one of the healthiest and most filling breakfast options. Unfortunately, it\u2019s also one of the messiest. Squeezing it into a bowl and trying to eat it from there is messy, difficult, and can be less than satisfying. Instead of making a mess, get individual packets of oatmeal. They\u2019re easy to make and you can quickly and easily pour them into a bowl or cup to eat."),mdx("p",null,"Make sure to check the ingredients on the oatmeal packet to make sure that there are no preservatives or other unnecessary additives. You can also sweeten the oatmeal with honey or other natural sweeteners."),mdx("h2",null,"Cheese stick and string bean combo"),mdx("p",null,"These two healthy snacks are great together. Cheese is a wonderful snack because it\u2019s full of protein and calcium. You can also choose between different types of cheese and mix up your selections, so they don\u2019t get boring. String beans are a great vegetable because they\u2019re very low in calories, but they\u2019re also high in fiber."),mdx("p",null,"This combination is simple because you can eat the string beans and cheese as is. You can also dip the cheese in the beans, or you can wrap the string beans around the cheese and eat them together."),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"These 30 healthy snacks for on-the-go will help you stay healthy and satisfied. They\u2019re all easy to prepare or purchase premade and they\u2019re all packed with vitamins, minerals, and other nutrients. Whether you\u2019re trying to lose weight or just eating healthy, these snacks are a great way to stay satisfied while also getting the nutrients you need."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

Whether in a home, restaurant, cafeteria or any other eatery, almost all food establishments serve high-calorie, high-sugar and high-fat meals that are laden with salt and unhealthy oils.What is unfortunate about this situation is that many people have no choice but to eat this way on a regular basis. If you work in an office, it\u2019s highly likely that your building has its own kitchen where a catered lunch service prepares hot lunches for staff every day. Similarly, if you go to school, there will most likely be a canteen serving the same type of unhealthy food as an adult educational institution.The good news is that even if you are stuck eating these foods on a daily basis, you can make your kitchen a healthier place by altering what goes into the meals you cook at home and the ones that you buy. Here are some tips on how you can do just that:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Eat Healthy on a Budget

var u=Object.defineProperty,d=Object.defineProperties;var c=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var s=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var h=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,i=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var r=(e,t,o)=>t in e?u(e,t,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:o}):e[t]=o,n=(e,t)=>{for(var o in t||(t={}))h.call(t,o)&&r(e,o,t[o]);if(s)for(var o of s(t))i.call(t,o)&&r(e,o,t[o]);return e},y=(e,t)=>d(e,c(t));var l=(e,t)=>{var o={};for(var a in e)h.call(e,a)&&t.indexOf(a)<0&&(o[a]=e[a]);if(e!=null&&s)for(var a of s(e))t.indexOf(a)<0&&i.call(e,a)&&(o[a]=e[a]);return o};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(o){var a=o,{components:e}=a,t=l(a,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,y(n(n({},layoutProps),t),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`How much does buying healthy food cost? For some it might be a small splurge, for others, a luxury they can\u2019t afford. Either way, eating healthy on a budget isn\u2019t easy. Eating less processed and pre-packaged foods is one way to cut costs and stay healthy at the same time. Another way is to get creative and buy things when they are on special or use cheaper alternatives like frozen or canned versions of fruits and veggies instead of the fresh ones. There are many ways to do this that won\u2019t leave you feeling deprived while still giving your body what it needs to be healthy.
For those who eat a lot of fast food or find themselves eating unhealthy because it\u2019s cheaper than buying wholesome foods, these tips will help you make healthier choices while saving money at the same time.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

How to Get over a Break-Up

Break-ups are never easy, and they can be even more difficult and hurtful if it\u2019s with your first love or someone you really cared about. These tips will help get you through any heartbreak and back into a place of peace.
When you experience a break-up, whether it\u2019s from a partner, friend or family member, it leaves you with an empty feeling. It hurts so much because you placed so many emotions into the relationship that it now feels like a part of who you are has been taken from you. Even though the person who broke up with you may have been oblivious to the pain they were causing by ending things, that doesn\u2019t make breaking up any easier for anyone involved.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make a Healthy Grocery List on a Budget

Given that healthy food is generally more expensive than junk food, many people find it difficult to eat well on a budget. In fact, a recent study found that American families with incomes below $40,000 spend about 11 percent of their income on groceries. That\u2019s almost double the amount spent by households that earn more than $80,000 a year.
Fortunately, eating right doesn\u2019t have to be an expensive proposition. With some planning and diligence, you can create cheap grocery lists on a regular basis and keep your household in peak nutritional condition while doing so. The first step is making smart shopping choices when you go to the store. Here are some tips to help you stock up on cheap groceries:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Easy Ways to Cut Sugar from Your Diet

From the link between sugar and obesity to the prevalence of diabetes, research on sugar and its potential health effects continues to grow.
There are many different types of sugars out there, but common table sugar or sucrose is the one you need to cut back on. Eating too much sugar can lead to weight gain, high blood pressure and other health problems. If you\u2019ve read any articles about how bad sugar is for you, then you probably already know this. However, cutting back on sugar isn\u2019t always easy. Sugar is in almost everything! Luckily, we\u2019ve compiled a list of 10 super helpful tips that will teach you how to cut back on your intake of this not-so-nice white substance\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

After all, it\u2019s the season of tank tops, swimsuits, and short shorts. The problem is that not everyone hits the gym year-round or has access to a gym that fits their needs. If you tend to slack on your fitness game once the snow begins falling and leaves start falling from the trees again, now is the time to start making changes so that you\u2019re ready for summer.
Whether you\u2019re looking for ways to get back in shape after a long winter hibernation or just hoping to avoid ending up in an unflattering bathing suit this summer, hitting the gym as often as possible is essential. But what if you don\u2019t have a gym membership? Or what if you can only commit to working out at home? Luckily we have some great tips for how you can get in shape for summer no matter where you are.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Tips for Staying Motivated to Eat Healthy

In our fast-paced world, it can be challenging to stick with a diet or eating plan. It\u2019t not easy staying motivated and sticking with a diet when there are so many temptations around us. Eating the right foods is important for our long-term health. There are so many benefits of eating healthy foods and it may help you feel better, have more energy, and even live longer. However, many people find it difficult to maintain their eating habits because their life is full of distractions like work, school, and family obligations. Staying motivated takes time and effort but it\u2019t possible if you don\u2019t make small changes in your daily routine that support your goals. Here are"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
